content.title: Saphenous Vein Stripping and High Ligation
content.description: Traditional surgical treatment of great saphenous vein reflux involving groin incision, SFJ ligation, and vein removal with stripper device.
content.historical_context: Gold standard before endovenous thermal ablation; now largely replaced but still indicated in select cases

indications.historical: Primary treatment for symptomatic GSV reflux (pre-2000s)

technique.high_ligation: Groin incision, SFJ identification, flush ligation with division of all tributaries
technique.extent: Groin to knee (not to ankle - preserves saphenous nerve)

disadvantages: Higher complication rate vs thermal ablation

complications.nerve_injury: Saphenous nerve if stripped below knee
